update.description:
* Needs [this](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1871/fix-gui-plugin-tutorials-on-gazebo5/diff) gazebo pull request. Then the tutorial should work for gazebo5 and gazebo6.

* Change links to refer to `gazebo5` instead of `default`, so changes to default don't break tutorials.

* Also made some other minor style changes


http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=gui_overlay&cat=user_input&branch=gz6_gui_overlay
update.title: GUI Overlay plugins for Gazebo5/6

content.raw: Sounds good, thanks for handling this!
I targeted that pull request to the `gazebo6` branch, so it won't affect this tutorial. I'll make a separate pull request in any case
content.html: I targeted that pull request to the gazebo6 branch, so it won't affect this tutorial. I'll make a separate pull request in any case

content.raw: So do we need to fork the tutorial for gazebo6?
content.html: So do we need to fork the tutorial for gazebo6?

content.raw: The conditions to release a patch against a package in an already released Ubuntu distributions are [designed only for critical issues](https://wiki.ubuntu.com/StableReleaseUpdates#When). Even if that case, [I'm not very optimistic about getting them in](https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/urdfdom-headers/+bug/1471047).
content.html: The conditions to release a patch against a package in an already released Ubuntu distributions are designed only for critical issues. Even if that case, I'm not very optimistic about getting them in.

content.raw: the change is [here](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/commits/a8c36b665c282133658fa5adb9fb5a25bbbd9869); I'll make sure to link to this discussion when I make the PR
content.html: the change is here; I'll make sure to link to this discussion when I make the PR

content.raw: @\_jrivero_ what is the likelihood of ubuntu vivid gazebo version being updated to 5.1.0?
content.html: @_jrivero_ what is the likelihood of ubuntu vivid gazebo version being updated to 5.1.0?

update.description:
* Needs [this](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1871/fix-gui-plugin-tutorials-on-gazebo5/diff) gazebo pull request. Then the tutorial should work for gazebo5 and gazebo6.

* Change links to refer to `gazebo5` instead of `default`, so changes to default don't break tutorials.

* Also made some other minor style changes


http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=gui_overlay&cat=user_input&branch=gz6_gui_overlay
update.title: GUI Overlay plugins for Gazebo5/6

content.raw: I couldn't find an example world in gazebo. We can add one if it's necessary.
content.html: I couldn't find an example world in gazebo. We can add one if it's necessary.

content.raw: We could change the tutorial version to 5.1+ if we really want to make the change
content.html: We could change the tutorial version to 5.1+ if we really want to make the change

content.raw: good point, maybe it won't work for vivid and ROS users, who are still using 5.0.1
content.html: good point, maybe it won't work for vivid and ROS users, who are still using 5.0.1

content.raw: True, thanks. Just be aware that `AddSphereToLink` is not on gazebo 5.0, but on [5.1](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1429/add-msgs-modeltosdf-and-simple-shape/diff). I'm not sure if that changes anything.
content.html: True, thanks. Just be aware that AddSphereToLink is not on gazebo 5.0, but on 5.1. I'm not sure if that changes anything.

content.raw: I can take care of this if you want
content.html: I can take care of this if you want

content.raw: We don't provide a link or `wget` command for the world file in this example.
content.html: We don't provide a link or wget command for the world file in this example.

content.raw: I use `$PWD` instead of `pwd`, but both should work.
content.html: I use $PWD instead of pwd, but both should work.

content.raw: We should use the `msgs::*ToSDF` functions in this example with `AddSphereLink`. This will give better inertial properties. This can be in a separate pull request.
content.html: We should use the msgs::*ToSDF functions in this example with AddSphereLink. This will give better inertial properties. This can be in a separate pull request.

content.raw: Do you mind splitting this into multiple lines? It's easier to view diffs in the future.
content.html: Do you mind splitting this into multiple lines? It's easier to view diffs in the future.

update.description:
* Moved existing tutorial to `tutorial_5.0.md`

* Updated `tutorial.md` to work with Gazebo6:

    * All referenced bitbucket files pull from the `gazebo6` branch - it was pulling from an old branch which didn't compile against `gazebo6`.

    * Added updated screenshots

    * Changed a few details in the instructions.

http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=gui_overlay&cat=user_input&branch=gz6_gui_overlay
update.title: GUI Overlay plugins for Gazebo6
